Author: Stephen Gilbert
Notes: A menacing rat featured in this 1968 horror novel ; also appears in the film adaptation Willard , the 2003 remake Willard , and the sequel Ben

Author: Terry Pratchett
Work: The Amazing Maurice and his Educated Rodents
Notes: A near-blind albino rat with a guru-like guidance to the rats and the only one who can withstand Spider 's mind control

Author: China Mi√©ville
Notes: Fallen king of the rats , father of Saul , and locked into a centuries long feud with the Piper

Author: Eduard Uspenskiy
Notes: The Old Lady Shapoklyak 's pet rat , whom she keeps in her purse

Author: W. H. Beck
Notes: A class pet rat , who is prejudiced as a menace by the Midnight Academy until he proves them wrong by saving a kidnapped Iguana

Author: Frances Hodgeson Burnett
Notes: A domestic rat whom Sara Crewe befriends during her time as a servant at Miss Minchin 's Seminary ; she calls him a Bastille rat sent to be my friend

Author: Robert C. O'Brien
Work: Mrs. Frisby and the Rats of NIMH
Notes: Leader of the rats of NIMH

Author: Eve Titus
Notes: Basil 's archenemy and a master criminal

Author: Jules Verne
Notes: Heroine of the rat family , who sets to undo the evil magician Gardafour 's wicked spells

Author: Lynne Jonell
Notes: Emmy 's closest friend , who comforts the girl at stressful times and has amazing powers

Author: Suzanne Collins
Notes: Main character , giant rat ( gnawer ) , leader of the rat resistance

Author: Beatrix Potter
Work: The Tale of Samuel Whiskers or The Roly-Poly Pudding
Notes: A rat couple who try to make Tom Kitten into a pudding until they are driven away by John Joiner

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Notes: Pet rat of the March sisters

Author: Stephen Gilbert
Notes: A white rat who is befriended , and used for evil , in this 1968 horror novel ; also appears in the film adaptation Willard and the 2003 remake Willard

Author: Paul Zindel
Notes: A white pet of Sarah and Michael McGraw who becomes the leader of the mutant rats and introduces them to music and dance

Author: E. B . White
Notes: A barnyard rat who unwillingly helps Wilbur and cares more about eating things

Author: Barbara Wersba
Work: Walter : The Story of a Rat
Notes: A literate rat who tries to get to know Miss Pomeroy who shares a lot in common with him

Author: Cameron Stelzer
Notes: A circus rat , originally named Wentworth Winterbottom , who becomes a Pie Rat and a member of Captain Black Rat 's crew aboard the Apple Pie and is renamed Whisker
